title: How did Israel become so technologically advanced? - Quora

response.answer_text: When Jewish migrants formed Israel in 1947, they were not just migrants. They were wise and strong men; tech geniuses, philosophers, college graduates, etc. They brought their skills and talents to Israel. The question: How did Israel become so technologically advanced? The answer: Circumstances Israel didn’t had any natural resources such as petroleum or precious metals.Israel was surrounded by many enemies.They were always at a threat to extinction.So they decided not to give up and thus their journey of becoming technologically advanced started. As of now 2016, they are the fifth most innovative country by Bloomberg. Science and technology in Israel - Wikipedia Israel has the highest per capita of engineers and innovators. They have the highest number of scientists and technicians per capita in the world with 140 scientists and technicians per 10,000 employees. In comparison, the same is 85 per 10,000 in the United States and 83 per 10,000 in Japan. Some of their notable works Solar powered window MobileEye It combines a tiny digital camera with sophisticated algorithms to help drivers navigate more safely. The steering system-linked device sounds an alert when a driver is about to change lanes inadvertently, warns of an impending forward collision and detects pedestrians. MobileEye has deals with GM, BMW and Volvo, among others. Israel’s top 45 greatest inventions of all time I would like to sum up this answer in one quote. “ In Israel, a land lacking in natural resources, we learned to appreciate our greatest national advantage: our minds. Through creativity and innovation, we transformed barren deserts into flourishing fields and pioneered new frontiers in science and technology.” - Shimon Peres
